ants-yelling.title: A colony of ants yelling as loud as they possibly can
ants-yelling.desc:
Ants are tiny. If they yell, they’re still going to be tiny. It’ll be a sort of pathetic kind of yell.

Here, we’ve got a group of ants cented on the screen, with each represented by the word “AH.” Their screams are a simple animation that changes their font size, but even with their loudest voices they can still only reach 10px. Hey, at least they’re trying!

dance-audition.title: You’re up on the world’s #1 hit amateur dance show
dance-audition.desc:
Dancing is all about knowing the right moves. (Or at least, that’s what I think because I don’t know how to dance.) What’s the computer equivalent of a “move?” What about clicking a key on your keyboard!

To nail your audition, you’ll need to press the key on the screen. Every time you get the right key, a new one is picked at random, and a new random dance move is picked, too! There’s no time limit, but hitting the wrong key ends your audition.

banana-dealer.title: Desperate for bananas, low on cash, stuck in a volatile economy
banana-dealer.desc:
Bananas are getting expensive these days. Who knows how much a banana will cost tomorrow? Even worse, who knows how much a banana will cost in the next minute or second?

Play this game and try to buy as many bananas as you can without going broke! Start with $20 and try to buy bananas as the lowest price possible. The game ends when you try to buy a banana but don’t have enough money to afford it!

accidental-explosions.title: Someone keeps launching missiles by accident, and that person might be you
accidental-explosions.desc:
What does a missile look like? I don’t really know, but I figure that it creates an explosion, which when seen from above looks like a pulsing red circle.

In this story, I use JavaScript to track when the user moves their mouse. I then create an element at that exact location. Using CSS, I position that element at that exact location and have it run an animation to get bigger and smaller repeatedly. The result: missiles!

panic-button.title: A panic button designed to relieve panic
panic-button.desc: Feeling anxious? Like you’re ready to burst? Then this panic button is for you! Clicking this button is a surefire way to release a tiny bit of dopamine even in the scariest of times. (Unless you’re allergic to cats...)

gentle-giant.title: A gentle giant asking for directions to the local bowling alley
gentle-giant.desc:
A giant’s got to have a loud voice. That’s kind of scary. But how can they make themselves seem a little friendlier? What if all they’re asking is for directions to their favorite place?

In this story, the giant is represented by appropriately gigantic text. But to counteract this giganticness, the text is light and soft.
